column4: Recent research is trying to figure out how to make images accessible.
column10: would maybe wnat ot know what style furnite, like elaborate, modern etc.
column11: types of furniture pieces found. Also when it says people are talking it's more helpful to imagine hte scene, because one assumes for instance that people are in sitting areas of some sort.
column19: I would wonder if the trees are green or if it's more of a wintery scene. Also daylight or nightime? Also what is a shallow hill or tree? Like space?
column20: The fact htat it's a river running on the side of a specific geographical landmark.
column21: the wording is a little strange, not sure what they mean by shallow hills nad trees. Hills are low not shallow.
column28: How do we know it's American Thanksgiving?
column29: It's helpful that it's super short and concise, table wiht dishes and tons of food.
column30: I'm not sure about the American Thanksgiving portion. it feels like a big assumption, other countries eat turkey, which I'd assume is on the table, during other celebrations. Also, people who are not American will not have the same image I have invoked.
column37: Why is this on an artilce about tablewear?
column38: It's a good concise description of chefs in a kitchen. `
column39: Completely baffled as ot why it would be on an article about dishwear.
column46: Why soccer in a hair article?
column47: It's a great description particularly the fact the ball is coming toward the player.
column48: The description is great, oit's just irrelevant.
column56: I love htat it describes the setting and the view outside the window.
column64: If this is aobut interior design why is there no info about the design?
column66: I'm assuming that this room has some kind of decoration, but there is absolutely zero  mention of it, even if it's just a white room.
column73: What kind of plant life is around this river?
column75: Since a big part of hte ecosystem is the plant life it would be good ot know what if any plants are there. The context is important because it tells oyu how high up on the mountain you are.
column82: Are there two groups of men?`
column84: I'm confused a bit if there are three men trying ot get otthe ball, and then a second group of men where one is on the group. Or if the person  who fell is part of the three getting to the ball.
column91: I think for this and hte previous image, I wonder if there is there is osme indication of skin tone?
column92: Good to know they are in a office setting.
column93: How do we know htey are working together? Are they looking at each ohter? Talking? Also, are they all white men?
column94: Skin tones would be good to know.
column101: I like that it gave the placement of the images the picture.
column109: How many mountains in the mountain range?
column129: Confused, are the men showing pics of consumer goods like appliances/ Are they in a kitchen? Not context of setting.
column130: It strikes me that these images are not representative of at least gender. It's hard ot tell about skin tones nad race because there has ot been a single one wihh that information.
column136: Is there any ohter kind of food aside from turkey?
column138: I'm just wondering if there are any other things on the table.
column146: I think it's a very thorough description and it mentioned colors which is great.
column147: I think the detail about the floor could've been left out. I think the comment about the holes that could be windows is a bit of speculation.
column154: What kind of building is it? A skyscraper?
column155: I like it mentioned hte three types of materials.
column156: I don't like that it didn't mention what kind of building is on the pic.
column163: Are there any ads in the background?
column164: It describe hte standing and the action.
column165: It's unclear where there might be aspects of advertising here. Perhaps there is a billboard or something somewhere but that's purely speculation.
column175: It's really hard to tell for this one and hte previous one is whether  there is info htat is omitted or whether it's a poorly chosen picture and that's an important descrption.

column183: One of hte key questions that I have is how do I figure out if the picture descriptions are reliable or not. Like if there is a standard that the relevant information if accompanied by text should always be included isn't clear.
